page.title: 17Local History, Scoutmoor.
page.content: Views to the west from Scoutmoor are dominated by the{Peel Monument,}or Holcombe Tower above the village of Holcombe. This momument is in memory of the second Sir Robert Peel, a great Statesman and one time Prime Minister, to commemorate the services he rendered in connection with the repeal of the Corn Laws. The monument was built in 1852 by public subscription at a cost of Â£900. The monument serves as a prominent and useful land mark for any walker who may have lost his sense of direction. Beyond the path that forms part of Rossendale Way, and the open moorland is a cross making the summit of Whittle Pike at 468 metres. The cross is thought to be to the memory of a local scout leader.
